message: is this going to be the first hackathon in Nigeria?
Yes, I think. Google DevFest was a similar event but I wouldn't really call it a hackathon.

I've been to a couple (including one just this weekend). It's quite addictive. One potential tip's to work in a team if that's allowed. It's a chance to meet new people and have a whale of a time.

There's no pressure apart from self imposed goals. So, it's also a chance to try out new techniques and tools without having anyone to answer to apart from yourself. If there's something you've had on the backburner for a while, here's a chance to prototype it and get some feedback.

Last thing would be to scale one's goals to what can be achieved in a short period of time.

*That full-text search engine you've been meaning to write from scratch... might not be done in 24hrs.* :P

I tend to aim to have a solid complete project (with potential for future expansion) at the end for the show 'n tell sessions. So far, that's worked out pretty well.
Arrck... copy+paste borked the text. Time to click "wrap text" I guess.  :)
Crikey, that's a long message... Anyways, it might be useful to someone. Just remember to have fun. :)
